title: Footbag Results Canonical Workbook
description: This workbook contains an archive-quality, canonicalized history of competitive footbag results. All data is generated deterministically from source mirrors and curated overrides. Do not edit generated sheets directly.

title: How to Use This Workbook
description: Use filters, pivots, and lookups for analysis. If errors or missing identities are found, resolve them via the pipeline (overrides and scripts), then regenerate the workbook.

title: Year Sheets (1980–Present)
description: One sheet per competition year. Each row represents a placement in an event division. These sheets are optimized for browsing and pivot analysis.

title: Placements_ByPerson
description: Person-centric results table. Each row represents a single person’s placement in an event. This is the primary analytics table.

title: Analytics_Safe_Surface
description: Coverage-filtered results safe for statistics and charts. Excludes unresolved identities and rejected rows. Recommended for aggregate analysis.

title: Persons_Truth
description: Authoritative person identity table. Each person_id maps to exactly one canonical person name. This table is identity-locked and human-curated via overrides.

title: Persons_Unresolved
description: Names that could not be confidently resolved to a person_id. These require human review and may include non-person entities. This sheet is regenerated on every run.

title: Coverage Reports
description: Coverage and gap analysis by event and division. Used to assess historical completeness and prioritize recovery.

title: Quality Control Notes
description: QC checks ensure zero structural errors and flag anomalies without guessing. Warnings indicate review opportunities, not data corruption.

title: Editing Rules
description: Never edit generated CSVs or Excel sheets directly. All corrections must be made via overrides or recovery scripts and then regenerated.

title: Data Provenance
description: Results are derived from publicly available historical sources mirrored offline. This workbook reflects the best-known reconstruction at time of generation.

title: Versioning
description: This workbook is tied to a specific pipeline version and git tag. Reproducibility is guaranteed when run with the same inputs.
